meanings.definition: To use parts of something to repair or build something else.
meanings.sent1: I had to cannibalise my old computer to fix my new one.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to cannibalise an old car to get the spare parts needed for the repair.
meanings.sent3: When my toy broke, I decided to cannibalise it and make a new one out of the parts.
meanings.sent4: In order to create a unique sculpture, the artist would cannibalise various materials from old projects.
meanings.sent5: The inventor had to cannibalise different gadgets to build his latest invention.

meanings.definition: To use or take for one's own advantage.
meanings.sent1: She would cannibalise her sister's ideas and present them as her own.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to cannibalise the competitor's market share by offering better deals.
meanings.sent3: The clever student would cannibalise the study notes of others to improve her own grades.
meanings.sent4: The politician would cannibalise his opponent's speeches to gain more support.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox would cannibalise the leftovers of larger predators for an easy meal.

meanings.definition: To consume the flesh of one's own species.
meanings.sent1: In the horror movie, the monster would cannibalise other creatures in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The tribe's tradition forbade them to cannibalise their own kind, even in times of famine.
meanings.sent3: The zombie apocalypse story featured undead creatures that would cannibalise humans.
meanings.sent4: The survival show contestants were shocked to discover they had to cannibalise to stay alive.
meanings.sent5: The mythical creature was said to cannibalise its own kind to gain their powers.
